doctor.name: Dr. Tasmina Hossain
doctor.specialty: General, Laparoscopic & Colorectal SurgeonPiles, Gallbladder, Breast, Hernia, Fissure, & Fistula Surgery Specialist
doctor.info: Dr. Tasmina Hossain is a highly skilled General, Laparoscopic & Colorectal Surgeon, specializing in the surgical management of piles, gallbladder diseases, breast tumors, hernias, fissures, and fistulas. She holds an MBBS degree and has achieved FCPS in General Surgery as well as FCPS in Colorectal Surgery, making her an expert in minimally invasive and advanced colorectal procedures. As an Assistant Professor of Colorectal Surgery at Shaheed Suhrawardy Medical College & Hospital, she is dedicated to treating conditions such as hemorrhoids (piles), anal fissures, rectal prolapse, gallstones, breast lumps, and hernias. Her expertise in laparoscopic and laser surgery ensures faster recovery and minimal post-operative discomfort for patients.

chamber.address: Gemcon Business Tower, 255 New Circular Road, Malibagh, Dhaka

doctor.name: Prof. Dr. Ahamaduz Zaman
doctor.degree: MBBS, MS (General Surgery), PhD (Medical Science), FICS (USA)
doctor.workplace: Shaheed Tajuddin Ahmad Medical College, Gazipur &Shaheed Monsur Ali Medical College, Dhaka
doctor.info: Prof. Dr. Ahamaduz Zaman is a distinguished general, laparoscopic, colorectal, and laser surgeon in Dhaka, holding an MBBS, MS in General Surgery, PhD in Medical Science, and FICS (USA), with advanced training in laser and laparoscopic surgery. With over 40 years of surgical experience, he is notably the only PhD holder in colorectal surgery in Bangladesh. Formerly, he served as Head of the Department of Surgery at Shaheed Tajuddin Ahmad Medical College, Gazipur, and Shaheed Monsur Ali Medical College, Dhaka. Dr. Zaman specializes in the management of piles (hemorrhoids), fistula, fissure, pilonidal sinus, colorectal cancer, anal polyps, hernia, gallstones, appendicitis, varicose veins, breast lumps, and various abdominal and anorectal disorders. He consults at Proctosurgery Bangladesh, Uttara (5pm to 8pm, Saturday to Wednesday & 7pm to 9pm on Friday).
